department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
full_summary:
# 23584-240601 Non-Destructive Test Specimen Refurbishment of Visual Testing Plant Surveillance Assembly Unit

## Request for Proposal Details

* **Solicitation Number**: WS4337924381
* **Publication Date**: December 8, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: This opportunity is expired.
* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)

## Procurement Details

* **Procurement Category**: Goods (GD)
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open bidding
* **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal

## Item Description

* **Item Number**: 23584-240601
* **Description**: Non-Destructive Test Specimen (Visual Testing Plant Surveillance Assembly Unit)

## Requirements and Deliverables

The Canada Water Agency at Natural Resources Canada, Hamilton has a requirement for the refurbishment of up to 9 (Nine) of non-destructive testing certification Visual Testing Plant Surveillance Assembly Units, starting with an initial quantity of 3 (Three). Production of the additional units will be on an as needed basis, with the contract duration being 3 to 5 years. The units are to be refurbished as per the detailed engineering drawings contained in the requirements section below, with the addition of pre-determined flaws of various sizes and orientations. All deliverables must be received on or before 29th March 2024.

## Notification and Submission

This tender is posted on Ariba Discovery. All amendments to this tender will be posted in the Event Messages board in SAP Ariba. To access the full Request for Proposal, please log into your SAP Ariba account and ensure that your Government of Canada profile is complete.

## Contracting Authority

Ms. Vashti Ramnarine, Manager of Acquisitions, Ontario Region can be reached at vashti.ramnarine@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca. The bid submission date is January 18, 2024, by 14:00 EST. Late bids will not be accepted.

## Note
This tender is closed for bidding, and only interested parties are encouraged to review the full Request for Proposal documents for their information purposes. This is not an invitation to bid.
